name: df-lbs
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5
body: |- wceq(clbs, cmpt(s0, universe, crab(s1, cpw(cfv(cbs, cv(s0))), wsbc(s2, cfv(clspn, cv(s0)), wsbc(s3, cfv(csca, cv(s0)), wa(wceq(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s1)), cfv(cbs, cv(s0))), wral(s4, cv(s1), wral(s5, cdif(cfv(cbs, cv(s3)), csn(cfv(c0g, cv(s3)))), wn(wcel(co(cv(s5), cfv(cvsca, cv(s0)), cv(s4)), cfv(cv(s2), cdif(cv(s1), csn(cv(s4))))))))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ LBasis =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶ { s1 ‚àà P((Base ` s0))|[(LSpan ` s0)/ s2][(Scalar ` s0)/ s3]((s2 ` s1)=(Base ` s0)‚àß ‚àÄ(s4 ‚àà s1, ‚àÄ(s5 ‚àà((Base ` s3)\ {(0 ` s3)}), ¬¨(s5[(√ó ` s0)]s4)‚àà(s2 `(s1 \ { s4 })))))})
comment: Define the set of bases to a left module or left vector space. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Jun-2014.)
